publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; names of the ruling King, Patriarch and Metropolitan; incipits and headings of the constituent texts; directives for the ministers; musical notation signs above the lines; most of the abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numbers.
Incipits of some of the constituent texts are written alternately in red and black letters (s. fols. 48ra, 83ra, 107ra, etc.).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 140.0 folios, of which 2.0 blank, in 18.0 quires.
22.5 18.0 6.8
supportDesc.condition: Many leaves are stained with dirt. Fols. 51and 112 were cut and mended with the help of parchment strips.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.ab: Fluent, tending to elaboration, of uneven quality throughout the Ms.

decoNote.locus: Crudely drawn black ornamental band with geometric ornamentation motifs, under the text of Additio 4:
Two coloured (red, black) ornamental bands over cols. a-b, at the incipit of text I:
Coloured (red, black) ornamental band with interlaces, at the incipit of text II:

q.span: [Fol. 2r]: This is a book of the tabot of Mary (of) Śäglat, the monastery of the king of kings Gäbrä Mäsqäl.

[Fol. 2v]: This is a book of Betä Maryam (of) Säglat, which was donated to (St.) Mary by Wälättä Kidan so that it might be for her a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. He who stole it or erased (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul.

locus.span: Fol. 139rb: Scribe’s note on completing the writing.

q.span: [Fol. 139rb]: Praise be to God who has enabled me to complete (this writing) in peace, and to His Mother, the blessed Virgin Mary.

locus.span: ǝktihu lä-mädḫane ˁaläm „The hosts of the angels of the Saviour of the world“ written out for various liturgical occasions.

list.item: Crude notes and drawings of lines, in ink of different colours: fol. 1r. Crude notes: fols. 1v, 2v. A text written in red and black ink, possibly an Additio, has been fully erased: fol. 2v. Crude notes in the bottom margin: fols. 62r, 71r, 72r, etc. Notes in the upper margin, in red ink. Some of them refer to the texts beginning on respective pages while others indicate liturgical occasions on which particular Anaphoras are to be celebrated: fols. 65v, 74v, 83r, 88r, 90v, 96r, 101v, 107r, 114r, 115v, 124r, 131v, 137r, Crude note in the upper margin, in dark green ink: fol. 101v. Crude drawings of (apparently meaningless) lines: fol. 140v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

origin.origDate: Fol. 42va: Mǝnilǝk is mentioned as the ruling King. Fols. 48rb, 66va, etc.: Qerǝllos is mentioned as the Patriarch and Matewos as the Metropolitan. Fol. 96rb: Ṗeṭros is mentioned as the Patriarch. Mǝnilǝk II was the Emperor of Ethiopia in 1889-1913. Cyril V was the Patriarch of Alexandria in 1874-1927. Matewos was the Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1889-1926. The name of Ṗeṭros is mentioned for unclear reasons.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Wälättä Kidan (s. donation note, Additio 4). Supplication formulas within the text also mention Ḥabtä Mikaʾel, Täklä Mikaʾel, Wäldä Maryam.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
